verses.kjv: I say then, Hath God cast away his people? God forbid. For I also am an Israelite, of the seed of Abraham, of the tribe of Benjamin.
verses.ct: So I ask: has God rejected his people? Absolutely not! I myself am an Israelite, a descendant of Abraham, from the tribe of Benjamin.

verses.kjv: God hath not cast away his people which he foreknew. Wot ye not what the scripture saith of Elias? how he maketh intercession to God against Israel, saying,
verses.ct: God has not rejected the people he chose in advance. Don't you remember what Scripture says about Elijah? He pleaded with God against Israel, saying,

verses.kjv: Lord, they have killed thy prophets, and digged down thine altars; and I am left alone, and they seek my life.
verses.ct: 'Lord, they have killed your prophets and torn down your altars. I'm the only one left, and now they're trying to kill me too.'

verses.kjv: But what saith the answer of God unto him? I have reserved to myself seven thousand men, who have not bowed the knee to the image of Baal.
verses.ct: But what was God's response to him? 'I have kept for myself 7,000 men who have not knelt before the idol of Baal.'

verses.kjv: Even so then at this present time also there is a remnant according to the election of grace.
verses.ct: In the same way, at this present time there is a remnant chosen by grace.

verses.kjv: And if by grace, then is it no more of works: otherwise grace is no more grace. But if it be of works, then is it no more grace: otherwise work is no more work.
verses.ct: If it is by grace, then it is no longer based on works — otherwise grace would no longer be grace. But if it were based on works, then it would no longer be grace — otherwise work would no longer be work.

verses.kjv: What then? Israel hath not obtained that which he seeketh for; but the election hath obtained it, and the rest were blinded.
verses.ct: So what happened? Israel did not achieve what it was striving for, but those who were chosen did achieve it. The rest had their minds hardened.

verses.kjv: (According as it is written, God hath given them the spirit of slumber, eyes that they should not see, and ears that they should not hear;) unto this day.
verses.ct: As Scripture says, 'God gave them a spirit of numbness, eyes that cannot see and ears that cannot hear, right up to this very day.'

verses.kjv: And David saith, Let their table be made a snare, and a trap, and a stumblingblock, and a recompence unto them:
verses.ct: David says, 'Let their feasting table become a snare, a trap, a stumbling block, and a punishment for them.

verses.kjv: Let their eyes be darkened, that they may not see, and bow down their back alway.
verses.ct: Let their eyes be darkened so they cannot see, and keep their backs bent down forever.'

verses.kjv: I say then, Have they stumbled that they should fall? God forbid: but rather through their fall salvation is come unto the Gentiles, for to provoke them to jealousy.
verses.ct: So I ask: did they stumble so that they would be permanently ruined? Absolutely not! Instead, because of their failure, salvation has come to the Gentiles, in order to make Israel jealous.

verses.kjv: Now if the fall of them be the riches of the world, and the diminishing of them the riches of the Gentiles; how much more their fulness?
verses.ct: Now if their failure means riches for the world, and their loss means riches for the Gentiles, imagine how much greater the blessing will be when they come to fullness!

verses.kjv: For I speak to you Gentiles, inasmuch as I am the apostle of the Gentiles, I magnify mine office:
verses.ct: I'm speaking directly to you Gentiles now. Since I am the apostle to the Gentiles, I take my role seriously.

verses.kjv: If by any means I may provoke to emulation them which are my flesh, and might save some of them.
verses.ct: My hope is that I might somehow stir my own people to jealousy and save some of them.

verses.kjv: For if the casting away of them be the reconciling of the world, what shall the receiving of them be, but life from the dead?
verses.ct: Because if their rejection brought reconciliation to the world, what will their acceptance bring? It will be nothing less than life from the dead!

verses.kjv: For if the firstfruit be holy, the lump is also holy: and if the root be holy, so are the branches.
verses.ct: If the first portion of dough offered is holy, then the whole batch is holy. And if the root is holy, the branches are holy too.

verses.kjv: And if some of the branches be broken off, and thou, being a wild olive tree, wert graffed in among them, and with them partakest of the root and fatness of the olive tree;
verses.ct: Now if some of the branches were broken off, and you — a wild olive shoot — were grafted in among the remaining branches to share in the nourishing sap from the olive tree's root,

verses.kjv: Boast not against the branches. But if thou boast, thou bearest not the root, but the root thee.
verses.ct: don't look down on those branches. If you do, remember this: you don't support the root — the root supports you.

verses.kjv: Thou wilt say then, The branches were broken off, that I might be graffed in.
verses.ct: You might say, 'Those branches were broken off so that I could be grafted in.'

verses.kjv: Well; because of unbelief they were broken off, and thou standest by faith. Be not highminded, but fear:
verses.ct: That's true. They were broken off because of unbelief, and you stand in your place through faith. So don't be arrogant — instead, deeply revere God.

verses.kjv: For if God spared not the natural branches, take heed lest he also spare not thee.
verses.ct: After all, if God didn't spare the natural branches, he won't spare you either.

verses.kjv: Behold therefore the goodness and severity of God: on them which fell, severity; but toward thee, goodness, if thou continue in his goodness: otherwise thou also shalt be cut off.
verses.ct: Consider, then, both the kindness and the strictness of God: strictness toward those who fell away, but kindness toward you — as long as you continue in his kindness. Otherwise, you too will be cut off.

verses.kjv: And they also, if they abide not still in unbelief, shall be graffed in: for God is able to graff them in again.
verses.ct: And if they don't persist in their unbelief, they will be grafted back in, because God has the power to graft them in again.

verses.kjv: For if thou wert cut out of the olive tree which is wild by nature, and wert graffed contrary to nature into a good olive tree: how much more shall these, which be the natural branches, be graffed into their own olive tree?
verses.ct: After all, if you were cut from a wild olive tree and grafted — against nature — into a cultivated olive tree, how much more easily will these natural branches be grafted back into their own olive tree!

verses.kjv: For I would not, brethren, that ye should be ignorant of this mystery, lest ye should be wise in your own conceits; that blindness in part is happened to Israel, until the fulness of the Gentiles be come in.
verses.ct: Brothers and sisters, I don't want you to be unaware of this mystery, so that you won't become proud in your own thinking: a partial hardening has come upon Israel until the full number of Gentiles has come in.

verses.kjv: And so all Israel shall be saved: as it is written, There shall come out of Sion the Deliverer, and shall turn away ungodliness from Jacob:
verses.ct: And in this way, all Israel will be saved. As Scripture says, 'The Deliverer will come from Zion; he will remove ungodliness from Jacob.

verses.kjv: For this is my covenant unto them, when I shall take away their sins.
verses.ct: This is my covenant with them: when I take away their sins.'

verses.kjv: As concerning the gospel, they are enemies for your sakes: but as touching the election, they are beloved for the fathers’ sakes.
verses.ct: Regarding the gospel, they are treated as enemies for your benefit. But regarding God's chosen purpose, they are deeply loved because of the patriarchs.

verses.kjv: For the gifts and calling of God are without repentance.
verses.ct: Because God's gifts and his calling can never be taken back.

verses.kjv: For as ye in times past have not believed God, yet have now obtained mercy through their unbelief:
verses.ct: At one time you did not believe God, but now you have received mercy because of their unbelief.

verses.kjv: Even so have these also now not believed, that through your mercy they also may obtain mercy.
verses.ct: In the same way, they are now in unbelief so that, through the mercy shown to you, they too may receive mercy.

verses.kjv: For God hath concluded them all in unbelief, that he might have mercy upon all.
verses.ct: For God has bound everyone over to disobedience so that he might show mercy to everyone.

verses.kjv: O the depth of the riches both of the wisdom and knowledge of God! how unsearchable are his judgments, and his ways past finding out!
verses.ct: How incredibly deep are the riches of God's wisdom and knowledge! His decisions are impossible to fully explore, and his methods are beyond tracing out!

verses.kjv: For who hath known the mind of the Lord? or who hath been his counsellor?
verses.ct: For who has ever understood the mind of the Lord? Who has ever served as his advisor?

verses.kjv: Or who hath first given to him, and it shall be recompensed unto him again?
verses.ct: Who has ever given something to God first, so that God would owe them something in return?

verses.kjv: For of him, and through him, and to him, are all things: to whom be glory for ever. Amen.
verses.ct: For everything comes from him, exists through him, and is directed toward him. To him be glory forever. Amen.
